subject: Re: [junit] My world is realer than your world
msgSnippet: ... I never said it was not possible, I was just complaining about the way Agile developers try to convince their audience. As for the sloppiest part, about
messageBody:
On 6/12/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
>
> I love you, Cedric, like a brother /and/ I think this rant is the single
> sloppiest thing you've ever written. I don't have the energy to list all
> the problems with it, but I will point out that someone on this list
> wrote about 300 pages on bringing Java legacy code under test, including
> dozens of examples that cover the core of a J2EE application. What more
> do you need?


I never said it was not possible, I was just complaining about the way Agile
developers try to convince their audience.

As for the "sloppiest" part, about forty people have commented on my post so
far, and a lot of them with experiences confirming my observations. Maybe
you find it sloppy, but I suggest you look beyond the form, because there
are obviously some real points in there...

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
